Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Fluency \Flu"en*cy\, n. [L. fluentia: cf. F. fluence. See {Fluent}.] The quality of being fluent; smoothness; readiness of utterance; volubility. [1913 Webster]
The art of expressing with fluency and perspicuity. --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
fluency n 1: powerful and effective language [syn: {eloquence}] 2: skillfulness in speaking or writing 3: the quality of being facile in speech and writing [syn: {volubility}, {articulateness}]
